summary.para: Creates a composition target object that is bound to the window that is represented by the specified window handle (HWND).
summary.param: The window to which the composition target object should be bound. This parameter must not be NULL.
TRUE if the visual tree should be displayed on top of the children of the window specified by the hwnd parameter; otherwise, the visual tree is displayed behind the children.
The new composition target object. This parameter must not be NULL.
The new 3D translation transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Provides access to rendering features that help with application debugging and performance tuning. This interface can be queried from the DirectComposition device interface.

summary.param: Receives the created instance of IDCompositionColorMatrixEffect.
The new 2D skew transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Represents an arbitrary 3D transformation defined by a 4-by-4 matrix.

summary.param: The new rotation transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Represents a binding between a Microsoft DirectComposition visual tree and a destination on top of which the visual tree should be composed.
Sets the coefficients for the equation used to composite the two input images.
summary.param: The coefficients for the equation used to composite the two input images.

summary.para: The Gaussian blur effect is used to blur an image by a Gaussian function, typically to reduce image noise and reduce detail.
Represents one DirectComposition visual in a visual tree.
Creates a surface object that can be associated with one or more visuals for composition.
summary.param: The width of the surface, in pixels.
The height of the surface, in pixels.
The pixel format of the surface.

The format of the alpha channel, if an alpha channel is included in the pixel format. This can be one of DXGI_ALPHA_MODE_PREMULTIPLIED or DXGI_ALPHA_MODE_IGNORE. It can also be DXGI_ALPHA_MODE_UNSPECIFIED, which is interpreted as DXGI_ALPHA_MODE_IGNORE.
The newly created surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.
The new 3D rotation transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the alpha channel.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the alpha channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the Alpha channel. If you set this to FALSE it applies the AlphaLinearTransfer function to the Alpha channel.

summary.para: Creates surface and virtual surface objects associated with an application-provided rendering device.
Sets the Content property of this visual to the specified bitmap or window wrapper.
summary.param: The object that is the new content of this visual. This parameter can be NULL.

summary.para: Creates a 2D transform group object that holds an array of 2D transform objects.
summary.param: An array of 2D transform objects that make up this transform group.
The number of elements in the transforms array.
The new transform group object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Represents a function for animating one or more properties of one or more Microsoft DirectComposition objects.
Creates a new DirectComposition device object, which can be used to create other DirectComposition objects.
summary.param: An optional pointer to a DirectX device to be used to create DirectComposition surface objects. Must be a pointer to an object implementing the IDXGIDevice or ID2D1Device interfaces.
The identifier of the interface to retrieve. This must be one of __uuidof(IDCompositionDevice) or __uuidof(IDCompositionDesktopDevice).
Receives an interface pointer to the newly created device object. The pointer is of the type specified by the iid parameter. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: The brightness effect controls the brightness of the image.

summary.param: The new 3D scale transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Represents a 2D transformation that affects the rotation of a visual around the z-axis. The coordinate system is rotated around the specified center point.
Changes the logical size of this virtual surface object.
summary.param: The new width of the virtual surface, in pixels. The maximum width is 16,777,216 pixels.
The new height of the virtual surface, in pixels. The maximum height is 16,777,216 pixels.
The new visual object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Creates an updateable surface object that can be associated with one or more visuals for composition.
summary.param: The width of the surface, in pixels.
The height of the surface, in pixels.
The pixel format of the surface.
The newly created surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: This effect is used to alter the saturation of an image. The saturation effect is a specialization of the color matrix effect.
Sets the coordinates where the turbulence output is generated.
summary.param:
The coordinates where the turbulence output is generated. The algorithm used to generate the Perlin noise is position dependent, so a different offset results in a different output. This value is not bounded and the units are specified in DIPs
Note Note The offset does not have the same effect as a translation because the noise function output is infinite and the function will wrap around the tile.

summary.para: Creates a composition target object that is bound to the window that is represented by the specified window handle.
summary.param: The window to which the composition target object should be bound. This parameter must not be NULL.
TRUE if the visual tree should be displayed on top of the children of the window specified by the hwnd parameter; otherwise, the visual tree is displayed behind the children.
The new composition target object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Creates an animation object that is used to animate one or more scalar properties of one or more Microsoft DirectComposition objects.
summary.param: The new animation object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Creates a 2D transform group object that holds an array of 2D transform objects.
summary.param: An array of 2D transform objects that make up this transform group.
The number of elements in the transforms array.
The new transform group object. This parameter must not be NULL.
The new 3D scale transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Represents a 3D transformation that affects the offset of a visual along the x-axis, y-axis, and z-axis.
Determines whether the DirectComposition device object is still valid.
summary.param: TRUE if the DirectComposition device object is still valid; otherwise FALSE.

summary.para: Adds a sinusoidal segment to the animation function.
summary.param: The offset, in seconds, from the beginning of the animation function to the point when this segment should take effect.
A constant that is added to the sinusoidal.
A scale factor that is applied to the sinusoidal.
A scale factor that is applied to the time offset, in Hertz.
A constant that is added to the time offset, in degrees.

summary.para: Represents a 2D transformation that can be used to modify the coordinate space of a visual subtree.
Creates a Microsoft DirectComposition surface factory object, which can be used to create other DirectComposition surface or virtual surface objects.
summary.param: A pointer to a DirectX device to be used to create DirectComposition surface objects. Must be a pointer to an object implementing the IDXGIDevice or ID2D1Device interfaces. This parameter must not be NULL.
The newly created surface factory object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Creates a new device object that can be used to create other Microsoft DirectComposition objects.
summary.param: The DXGI device to use to create DirectComposition surface objects.
The identifier of the interface to retrieve.
Receives an interface pointer to the newly created device object. The pointer is of the type specified by the iid parameter. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Creates an object that represents multiple effects to be applied to a visual subtree.
summary.param: The new effect group object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: The color matrix effect alters the RGBA values of a bitmap.
Creates a 3D transform group object that holds an array of 3D transform objects.
summary.param: An array of 3D transform objects that make up this transform group.
The number of elements in the transforms array.
The new 3D transform group object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Sets the alpha mode of the output for the color matrix effect.
summary.param: The alpha mode of the output for the color matrix effect.
The new 2D translation transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.
The color of the shadow.

summary.para: Sets the mode used to calculate the border of the image.
summary.param: The mode used to calculate the border of the image.

summary.para: Sets a visual object as the new root object of a visual tree.
summary.param: The visual object that is the new root of this visual tree. This parameter can be NULL.

summary.para: Retrieves information from the composition engine about composition times and the frame rate.
summary.param: A structure that receives composition times and frame rate information.

summary.para: Adds a cubic polynomial segment to the animation function.
summary.param: The offset, in seconds, from the beginning of the animation function to the point when this segment should take effect.
The constant coefficient of the polynomial.
The linear coefficient of the polynomial.
The quadratic coefficient of the polynomial.
The cubic coefficient of the polynomial.

summary.para: Creates an Interaction/InputSink to route mouse wheel messages to the given HWND.
summary.param: The visual to route messages from.
The HWND to route messages to.
Boolean value indicating whether to enable or disable routing.

summary.para: Represents a 2D transformation that affects the scale of a visual along the x-axis and y-axis. The coordinate system is scaled from the specified center point.

summary.param: Receives the created instance of IDCompositionHueRotationEffect.

summary.para: Changes the value of the visual's Visible property.
summary.param: The new value for the visible property.

summary.para: Waits for the composition engine to finish processing the previous call to the IDCompositionDevice::Commit method.
Enables highlighting visuals when content is being redrawn.
Creates a wrapper object that represents the rasterization of a layered window, and that can be associated with a visual for composition.
summary.param: The handle of the layered window for which to create a wrapper. A layered window is created by specifying WS_EX_LAYERED when creating the window with the CreateWindowEx function or by setting WS_EX_LAYERED via SetWindowLong after the window has been created.
The new composition surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Sets the depth mode property associated with this visual.
summary.param: The new depth mode.

summary.para: Creates a sparsely populated surface that can be associated with one or more visuals for composition.
summary.param: The width of the surface, in pixels. The maximum width is 16,777,216 pixels.
The height of the surface, in pixels. The maximum height is 16,777,216 pixels.
The pixel format of the surface.

The format of the alpha channel, if an alpha channel is included in the pixel format. This can be one of DXGI_ALPHA_MODE_PREMULTIPLIED or DXGI_ALPHA_MODE_IGNORE. It can also be DXGI_ALPHA_MODE_UNSPECIFIED, which is interpreted as DXGI_ALPHA_MODE_IGNORE.
The newly created virtual surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Changes all values of the matrix of this 2D transform.
summary.param: The new matrix for this 2D transform.

summary.para: Creates a clip object that can be used to restrict the rendering of a visual subtree to a rectangular area.
summary.param: The new clip object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Sets the list of values used to define the transfer function for the red channel.
summary.param: The list of values used to define the transfer function for the red channel.
The number of values in the tableValues parameter.

summary.para: Discards pixels that fall outside of the specified trim rectangles.
summary.param: An array of rectangles to keep.
The number of rectangles in the rectangles array.
Receives the created instance of IDCompositionCompositeEffect.
Receives the created instance of IDCompositionBlendEffect.

summary.para: Creates an Interaction/InputSink to route mouse button down and any subsequent move and up events to the given HWND.
summary.param: The visual to route messages from.
The HWND to route messages to.
Boolean value indicating whether to enable or disable routing.

summary.para: The linear transfer effect is used to map the color intensities of an image using a linear function created from a list of values you provide for each channel.

summary.param: The new 3D translation transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.
The new 3D matrix transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Represents a group of bitmap effects that are applied together to modify the rasterization of a visual's subtree.
Serves as a factory for all other Microsoft DirectComposition objects and provides methods to control transactional composition.
Sets the absolute time at which the animation function starts.
summary.param: The starting time for this animation.

summary.para: The arithmetic composite effect is used to combine 2 images using a weighted sum of pixels from the input images.

The shadow effect is used to generate a shadow from the alpha channel of an image. The shadow is more opaque for higher alpha values and more transparent for lower alpha values. You can set the amount of blur and the color of the shadow.
Represents a clip object that restricts the rendering of a visual subtree to the specified rectangular region. Optionally, the clip object may have rounded corners specified.
Represents a sparsely allocated bitmap that can be associated with a visual for composition in a visual tree.

summary.param: The new visual object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Specifies whether the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before the effect passes the values to the next effect in the graph.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before the effect passes the values to the next effect in the graph. If you set this to TRUE the effect will clamp the values. If you set this to FALSE, the effect will not clamp the color values, but other effects and the output surface may clamp the values if they are not of high enough precision.

summary.para: Enables a visual heatmap that represents overdraw regions.

summary.param: The new 2D scale transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Represents a clip object that is used to restrict the rendering of a visual subtree to a rectangular area.
Sets the seed for the pseudo random generator.
summary.param: The seed for the pseudo random generator. This value is unbounded.

summary.para: Sets the Effect property of this visual.
summary.param: A pointer to an effect object. This parameter can be NULL.

summary.para: Initiates drawing on this Microsoft DirectComposition surface object.
summary.param: The rectangle to be updated. If this parameter is NULL, the entire bitmap is updated.
The identifier of the interface to retrieve.

Receives an interface pointer of the type specified in the iid parameter. This parameter must not be NULL.
Note In Windows 8, this parameter was surface.
The offset into the surface where the application should draw updated content. This offset will reference the upper left corner of the update rectangle.

summary.para: Scrolls a rectangular area of a Microsoft DirectComposition logical surface.
summary.param: The rectangular area of the surface to be scrolled, relative to the upper-left corner of the surface. If this parameter is NULL, the entire surface is scrolled.

The clipRect clips the destination (scrollRect after offset) of the scroll. The only bitmap content that will be scrolled are those that remain inside the clip rectangle after the scroll is completed.
The amount of horizontal scrolling, in pixels. Use positive values to scroll right, and negative values to scroll left.
The amount of vertical scrolling, in pixels. Use positive values to scroll down, and negative values to scroll up.

summary.para: The hue rotate effect alters the hue of an image by applying a color matrix based on the rotation angle.
Changes all values of the matrix of this 3D transformation effect.
summary.param: The new matrix for this 3D transformation effect.

summary.para: Represents a 3D transformation effect that can be used to modify the rasterization of a visual subtree.
Represents a physical bitmap that can be associated with a visual for composition in a visual tree. This interface can also be used to update the bitmap contents.
Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the blue channel.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the blue channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the blue channel. If you set this to FALSE it applies the BlueTableTransfer function to the Blue channel.

summary.para: Creates a new composition surface object that can be bound to a Microsoft DirectX swap chain or swap buffer and associated with a visual.
summary.param: Contains the security descriptor for the composition surface object, and specifies whether the handle of the composition surface object is inheritable when a child process is created. If this parameter is NULL, the composition surface object is created with default security attributes that grant read and write access to the current process, but do not enable child processes to inherit the handle.
The handle of the new composition surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Creates a sparsely populated surface that can be associated with one or more visuals for composition.
summary.param: The width of the surface, in pixels. The maximum width is 16,777,216 pixels.
The height of the surface, in pixels. The maximum height is 16,777,216 pixels.
The pixel format of the surface.
The newly created surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Creates a 3D transform group object that holds an array of 3D transform objects.
summary.param: An array of 3D transform objects that make up this transform group.
The number of elements in the transforms array.
The new 3D transform group object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Sets the border mode to use with the effect.
summary.param: Specifies the border mode to use with the effect.

summary.para: Serves as a factory for all other Microsoft DirectComposition objects and provides methods to control transactional composition.
Creates a wrapper object that represents the rasterization of a layered window, and that can be associated with a visual for composition.
summary.param: The handle of the layered window for which to create a wrapper. A layered window is created by specifying WS_EX_LAYERED when creating the window with the CreateWindowEx function or by setting WS_EX_LAYERED via SetWindowLong after the window has been created.
The new composition surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.
Receives the created instance of IDCompositionArithmeticCompositeEffect.

summary.para: Sets the blend mode to use when the blend effect combines the two images.
summary.param: The blend mode to use when the blend effect combines the two images.

summary.para: Resumes drawing on this Microsoft DirectComposition surface object.
Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the green channel.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the green channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the green channel. If you set this to FALSE it applies the GreenTableTransfer function to the green channel.

summary.para: The Blend Effect is used to combine 2 images.
Creates a new composition surface object that wraps an existing composition surface.
summary.param: The handle of an existing composition surface that was created by a call to the DCompositionCreateSurfaceHandle function.
The new composition surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Sets the the input at an index to the specified filter effect.
summary.param: Specifies the index the to apply the filter effect at.

The filter effect to apply. The following effects are available:
IDCompositionAffineTransform2DEffect
IDCompositionArithmeticCompositeEffect
IDCompositionBlendEffect
IDCompositionBrightnessEffect
IDCompositionColorNatrixEffect
IDCompositionCompositeEffect
IDCompositionFloodEffect
IDCompositionGaussianBlurEffect
IDCompositionHueRotationEffect
IDCompositionLinearTransferRffect
IDCompositionSaturationRffect
IDCompositionShadowEffect
IDCompositionTableTransferEffect
IDCompositionTurbulenceEffect
Flags to apply to the filter effect.

summary.para: Creates a new device object that can be used to create other Microsoft DirectComposition objects.
summary.param: An optional pointer to a DirectX device to be used to create DirectComposition surface objects. Must be a pointer to an object implementing the IDXGIDevice or ID2D1Device interfaces.
The identifier of the interface to retrieve. This must be one of __uuidof(IDCompositionDevice) or __uuidof(IDCompositionDesktopDevice).
Receives an interface pointer to the newly created device object. The pointer is of the type specified by the iid parameter. This parameter must not be NULL.
Receives the created instance of IDCompositionTableTransferEffect.
The new 2D translation transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.
The new 2D skew transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Sets the TransformParent property of this visual. The TransformParent property establishes the coordinate system relative to which this visual is composed.
summary.param: The new visual that establishes the base coordinate system for this visual. This parameter can be NULL.
Receives the created instance of IDCompositionGaussianBlurEffect.
Receives the created instance of IDCompositionLinearTransferEffect.

summary.para: Sets the interpolation mode of the effect.
summary.param: Specifies the interpolation mode of the effect.

summary.para: Creates a clip object that can be used to restrict the rendering of a visual subtree to a rectangular area.
summary.param: The new clip object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Represents one DirectComposition visual in a visual tree.
Resets the animation function so that it contains no segments.
Suspends the drawing on this Microsoft DirectComposition surface object.
Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the blue channel.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the blue channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the blue channel. If you set this to FALSE it applies the BlueLinearTransfer function to the blue channel.

summary.para: Specifies whether or not surfaces that have 3D transformations applied to them should be displayed when facing away from the observer.
summary.param:
[in]
The back face visibility to use when composing surfaces in this visual’s sub-tree to the screen.

summary.para: Sets the upper portion of the brightness transfer curve.
summary.param: The upper portion of the brightness transfer curve. The white point adjusts the appearance of the brighter portions of the image. This vector is for both the x value and the y value, in that order. Each of the values must be between 0 and 1, inclusive.

summary.para: Sets the BitmapInterpolationMode property, which specifies the mode for Microsoft DirectComposition to use when interpolating pixels from bitmaps that are not axis-aligned or drawn exactly at scale.
summary.param: The interpolation mode to use.

summary.para: Sets the mode for the composite effect.
summary.param: The mode for the composite effect.

summary.para: Sets the matrix used by the effect to multiply the RGBA values of the image.
summary.param: The matrix used by the effect to multiply the RGBA values of the image. The matrix is column major and is applied as shown in the following equation:

summary.para: Sets the list of values used to define the transfer function for the green channel.
summary.param: The list of values used to define the transfer function for the green channel.
The number of values in the tableValues parameter.
The new 3D matrix transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Disables display of performance debugging counters.
Sets the transform matrix of the effect.
summary.param: Specifies the transform matrix for the effect to use.

summary.para: Represents a 3D transformation that affects the rotation of a visual along an arbitrary axis in 3D space. The coordinate system is rotated around the specified center point.

summary.param: The new matrix transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Adds a new child visual to the children list of this visual.
summary.param: The child visual to add. This parameter must not be NULL.
TRUE to place the new child visual in front of the visual specified by the referenceVisual parameter, or FALSE to place it behind referenceVisual.
The existing child visual next to which the new visual should be added.

summary.para: Retrieves information from the composition engine about composition times and the frame rate.
summary.param: A structure that receives composition times and frame rate information.

summary.para: Specifies the lower portion of the brightness transfer curve for the brightness effect.
summary.param: The lower portion of the brightness transfer curve. The black point adjusts the appearance of the darker portions of the image. The vector is for both the x value and the y value, in that order. Each of the values must be between 0 and 1, inclusive.

summary.para: Represents a bitmap effect that modifies the rasterization of a visual's subtree.
Adds an end segment that marks the end of an animation function.
summary.param: The offset, in seconds, from the beginning of the animation function to the point when the function ends.
The final value of the animation.
Receives the created instance of IDCompositionBrightnessEffect.

summary.para: Enables display of performance debugging counters.
Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the red channel.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the red channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the red channel. If you set this to FALSE it applies the RedTableTransfer function to the red channel.

summary.para: Represents a 2D transformation that affects the skew of a visual along the x-axis and y-axis. The coordinate system is skewed around the specified center point.
Creates a sparsely populated surface that can be associated with one or more visuals for composition.
summary.param: The width of the surface, in pixels. The maximum width is 16,777,216 pixels.
The height of the surface, in pixels. The maximum height is 16,777,216 pixels.
The pixel format of the surface.
The newly created surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Creates an updateable surface object that can be associated with one or more visuals for composition.
summary.param: The width of the surface, in pixels. Constrained by the feature level of the rendering device that was passed in at the time the DirectComposition device was created.
The height of the surface, in pixels. Constrained by the feature level of the rendering device that was passed in at the time the DirectComposition device was created.
The pixel format of the surface.
The newly created surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Sets the BorderMode property, which specifies how to compose the edges of bitmaps and clips associated with this visual, or with visuals in the subtree rooted at this visual.
summary.param: The border mode to use.

summary.para: Removes a child visual from the children list of this visual.
summary.param: The child visual to remove from the children list. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Specifies whether the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before the effects passes the values to the next effect in the chain.
summary.param: A boolean value indicating whether the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before the effects passes the values to the next effect in the chain.
The new 3D rotation transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Sets the 3D transformation effect object that modifies the rasterization of the visuals that this effect group is applied to.
summary.param: Pointer to an IDCompositionTransform3D interface or one of its derived interfaces. This parameter can be NULL.

summary.para: Represents an arbitrary affine 2D transformation defined by a 3-by-2 matrix.
Creates an animation object that is used to animate one or more scalar properties of one or more Microsoft DirectComposition objects.
summary.param: The new animation object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Sets the number of octaves for the noise function.
summary.param: The number of octaves for the noise function. This value must be greater than 0.

summary.para: Commits all DirectComposition commands that are pending on this device.

summary.param: Receives the created instance of IDCompositionShadowEffect.

summary.para: Creates an object that represents multiple effects to be applied to a visual subtree.
summary.param: The new effect group object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Specifies whether the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before the effect passes the values to the next effect in the graph.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether the effect clamps color values to between 0 and 1 before the effect passes the values to the next effect in the graph. If you set this to TRUE the effect will clamp the values. If you set this to FALSE, the effect will not clamp the color values, but other effects and the output surface may clamp the values if they are not of high enough precision. The effect clamps the values before it premultiplies the alpha.

summary.para: Sets the list of values used to define the transfer function for the blue channel.
summary.param: The list of values used to define the transfer function for the blue channel.
The number of values in the tableValues parameter.

summary.para: The composite effect is used to combine 2 or more images.
Marks the end of drawing on this Microsoft DirectComposition surface object.
Specifies whether stitching is on or off.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether stitching is on or off. The base frequency is adjusted so that the output bitmap can be stitched. This is useful if you want to tile multiple copies of the turbulence effect output. If this value is TRUE, the output bitmap can be tiled (using the tile effect) without the appearance of seams and the base frequency is adjusted so that output bitmap can be stitched. If this value is FALSE, the base frequency is not adjusted, so seams may appear between tiles if the bitmap is tiled.

summary.para: The turbulence effect is used to generate a bitmap based on the Perlin noise function. The turbulence effect has no input image.
Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the green channel.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the green channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the green channel. If you set this to FALSE it applies the GreenLinearTransfer function to the green channel.

summary.para: Waits for the composition engine to finish processing the previous call to the IDCompositionDevice2::Commit method.
Creates a new composition surface object that wraps an existing composition surface.
summary.param: The handle of an existing composition surface that was created by a call to the DCompositionCreateSurfaceHandle function.
The new composition surface object. This parameter must not be NULL.
The new matrix transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Specifies whether to clamp color values before the effect passes the values to the next effect in the graph.
summary.param: A boolean value indicating whether to clamp the color values. A value of TRUE causes color values to be clamped between 0 and 1.

summary.para: Sets the blending mode for this visual.
summary.param: The blending mode to use when composing the visual to the screen.
Recieves the created instance of IDCompositionAffineTransform2DEffect.

summary.para: Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the red channel.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the red channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the red channel. If you set this to FALSE the effect applies the RedLinearTransfer function to the red channel.

summary.para: Represents a 3D transformation effect that affects the scale of a visual along the x-axis, y-axis, and z-axis. The coordinate system is scaled from the specified center point.
Represents a 2D transformation that affects only the offset of a visual along the x-axis and y-axis.
Sets the base frequencies in the X and Y direction.
summary.param: The base frequencies in the X and Y direction. This must be greater than 0. The units are specified in 1/DIPs. A value of 1 (1/DIPs) for the base frequency results in the Perlin noise completing an entire cycle between two pixels. The ease interpolation for these pixels results in completely random pixels, since there is no correlation between the pixels. A value of 0.1(1/DIPs) for the base frequency results in the Perlin noise function repeating every 10 DIPs. This results in correlation between pixels and the typical turbulence effect is visible.

summary.para: Adds a repeat segment that causes the specified portion of an animation function to be repeated.
summary.param: The offset, in seconds, from the beginning of the animation to the point at which the repeat should begin.
The duration, in seconds, of a portion of the animation immediately preceding the begin time that is specified by beginOffset. This is the portion that will be repeated.

summary.para: Serves as a factory for all other Microsoft DirectComposition objects and provides methods to control transactional composition.
An application must use the IDCompositionDesktopDevice interface in order to use DirectComposition in a Win32 desktop application.

summary.param: Receives the created instance of IDCompositionSaturationEffect.
Receives the created instance of IDCompositionTurbulenceEffect.

summary.para: Sets the opacity mode for this visual.
summary.param: The opacity mode to use when composing the visual to the screen.

summary.para: Sets the size of the turbulence output.
summary.param: The size of the turbulence output

summary.para: The table transfer effect is used to map the color intensities of an image using a transfer function created from interpolating a list of values you provide.
Commits all DirectComposition commands that are pending on this device.
The arithmetic composite effect is used to combine 2 images using a weighted sum of pixels from the input images.

summary.param: The new 2D scale transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.

summary.para: Removes all visuals from the children list of this visual.

summary.param: The turbulence noise mode. Indicates whether to generate a bitmap based on Fractal Noise or the Turbulence function.

summary.para: Specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the Alpha channel.
summary.param: A boolean value that specifies whether to apply the transfer function to the alpha channel. If you set this to TRUE the effect does not apply the transfer function to the Alpha channel. If you set this to FALSE it applies the AlphaTableTransfer function to the Alpha channel.

summary.para: Sets the list of values used to define the transfer function for the alpha channel.
summary.param: The list of values used to define the transfer function for the alpha channel.
The number of values in the tableValues parameter.
The new rotation transform object. This parameter must not be NULL.
